item.title: [Machine learning] Understanding the decorrelation from mathematics
item.description: #1.Introduction ##(1. Purpose If you want to do machine learning, anyone can use scikit-learn etc. to implement it relatively easily. However, in order to achieve results at work or to improve your level, “I don’t really understand the background, but I got this result” I think it’s clearly weak. This time, we will focus on “correlation”**. “I’ve heard about decorrelation, why do you do it?” “How do you use it?

item.title: Python beginner publishes web application using machine learning [Part 1] Introduction
item.description: ### Purpose of this article Obstetrician and Gynecologist Tomi‘sarticle[[[Self-studypossible]LearningroadmapformachinelearningforPythonbeginners]](https://obgynai.Itriedtocreatetheroadmapmyselfbyreferringto(com/self-study-python-machine-learning/). This article is the first in a series of memo articles. For readability, the article is divided into pieces! (After writing, we will publish an article that summarizes everything) ###Self-introduction My name is Tsuba Mukku. After graduating from Kyushu University, I re-entered the National University School of Medicine. While aiming to graduate from medical school and pass the national exam of doctors, I am also learning pure mathematics and computer science (I also take classes in mathematics and information science).

item.title: Introduction to Deep Learning-Coding Preparation-
item.description: # Target audience It is a continuation of Last article. This article prepares for coding from now on. If you want to implement it yourself, but it is quite … please take a look. (Basically, I can’t use complicated techniques, so don’t worry.) ** The coding environment is jupyter notebook. ** If you want to manage it at the module level elsewhere, uncomment the command such as import. If it doesn’t work please let me know in the comments… Next article here

item.title: Application of affine transformation by tensor-From basics to object detection-
item.description: This article is about simplifying preprocessing by using affine transformation with tensors. The affine transformation can be applied to images, but the same transformation can be applied to annotations such as Bounding Box. You can also apply different transformations to one object at the same time by extending it to a tensor. Affine transformation basics The affine transformation represents the movement of points in the following formula. $$\begin{bmatrix}x’ \\ y’\\ 1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix}a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix}x \\ y \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} \tag{1}$$

item.title: Prediction of horse racing: If I thought that the collection rate exceeded 100% in machine learning (Light GBM), I did it
item.description: #Thank you Note!!! This article is completely disguised I’m sorry for the person who stocked it. Thanks to @hal27 for pointing it out, thank you. ・What I did I made a fatal mistake from the scraping stage. I was going to get the data for the previous 3 races from the time of the race, but in fact I was getting the information for the latest 3 races from the scraping execution time.

item.title: A memorandum of studying and implementing deep learning
item.description: # Target audience A person who has studied machine learning and deep learning in general, but who does not know how they are related when implementing. Someone who wants to organize their mind. I will not give a detailed mathematical explanation. See the chainer tutorial for a mathematical explanation. What became a model of deep learning Deep learning was created by imitating the mechanism of information transmission in human nerve cells.

item.title: [Implementation explanation] Japanese BERT x unsupervised learning (information maximization clustering) to classify livedoor news: Google Colaboratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, we will implement and explain how clustering is performed by using the Japanese version BERT in Google Colaboratory and performing unsupervised learning information maximization clustering for livedoor news. Using the Japanese version of BERT with Google Colaboratory, the content until vectorization of sentences, Information maximization clustering for unsupervised learning in MNIST About this, I have explained it in the series articles so far, so please see here first.

item.title: Simultaneous visualization of data and understanding of correlation
item.description: #Introduction When analyzing data, I think you will visualize the data using graphs. At that time, it would be convenient if the statistics showing the correlation between two variables could be displayed at the same time. Therefore, we made it possible to display the appropriate statistics on the appropriate graph according to the content of the variable (category or numerical value). Review so far I will summarize the appropriate graphing methods by content of variables and the statistics that show the correlation, which have been described so far.

item.title: [Hands-on for beginners] Kaggle's Predicting house prices is read line by line (1st part: Data reading)
item.description: # theme A job that operates a real estate system as a service, a story broke out that there is no loss in doing hands-on at the field level. That’s why we decided to challenge kaggle’s “House Price” problem, which is a famous title. So, if you make a note of this properly, it will be useful for later, so I decided to post it to qiita after reading the line by line.

item.title: The relationship between brain science and unsupervised learning. Information maximization with unsupervised learning MNIST: Google Colabratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, I will explain unsupervised learning and brain science, and IIC's implementation of high performance in MNIST for unsupervised learning. The papers of interest in this article are: Invariant Information Clustering for Unsupervised Image Classification and Segmentation is. In this paper, we utilize an index called mutual information to classify handwritten digit images by unsupervised learning clustering. It is called IIC (Invariant Information Clustering). In this article, we will discuss brain science and unsupervised learning, IIC points, and implementation examples in MNIST.

item.title: [For beginners] Neural network super introduction that can be understood even by cats
item.description: ![IMG_0489.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/458623/93e891ee-1dc8-fa4e-7bb5-5a1922ffe589.png) Written What is a neural network? a unit? weight? bias? Activation function Overview of NN Summary The goal is to get a general idea of the neural network. I don’t use mathematical formulas, so people who are allergic to mathematics should also check it. #1.What is a neural network? A neural network is something like the one below. When written in English, it is Neural Network, so it is often abbreviated as NN.

item.title: Causal reasoning using machine learning (arrangement of causal reasoning methods)
item.description: # Causal reasoning using machine learning A rough understanding and notes of when to use causal reasoning using machine learning methods that have been actively used in recent years (Memorandum) Basically, the current causal reasoning method is summarized as a flow chart. Introduction Causal reasoning is a series of statistical methods aimed at answering the cause of an outcome. Generally, statistical approaches such as regression analysis focus on quantifying how changes in X are related to changes in Y.

item.title: Summary of Markov chain and Monte Carlo method
item.description: #Introduction Currently, I am learning about Bayesian statistics. From that, I will summarize the Markov chain Monte Carlo method. In this article, I will explain the outline of Markov chain and Monte Carlo method as an entrance. Next article Here is the book that I referred to this time. Bayes statistics from the basics: a practical introduction to the Hamiltonian Monte Carlo method What is Markov chain Monte Carlo In Bayesian inference, when the observed data is $X$ and the set of unobserved variables such as parameters and latent variables is $Z$, consider the probabilistic model $P(X,Z)$.

item.title: [Implementation explanation] How to use Japanese version BERT in Google Colaboratory (PyTorch)
item.description: In this article, I will explain how to use the Japanese version of BERT with Google Colaboratory. About the BERT itself, the book I wrote last year “Learn while making! Development deep learning with PyTorch” Is explained in detail in. If you want to know how BERT works, please see the above book. Since the book only dealt with the English version, this post will explain how to use BERT in the Japanese version.

item.title: 5 Data Science Masterpieces You Can Learn for Free [Japanese books are not scared if you can speak English even if they are expensive]

There are other summary articles of this series, I would like to display translated Japanese books and original books side by side. Especially introduced only in the field of data science. Maybe that expensive original book is actually free? (As of May 2020) #1 Japanese: Basics of statistical learning (15,000 yen) It’s commonly called a “castella book.

I think it can be used as a review of knowledge. First, we will cover the basics of general-purpose Python syntax to a minimum, and then describe the basic tools and techniques used for data analysis.

item.title: Differences that C# engineers felt when they first learned python
item.description: Hi, this is [Muscle Training Clinical Engineering Engineer ken](https://twitter.com/ce_fitness_note). This is my first post on Qiita. I usually use C# to develop medical systems. I decided to focus on machine learning, so I started learning python. Even though I learned about it, I went around Progate’s python course, but I will briefly summarize the differences between C# and how to write. If you usually use C#, C++, VB and want to learn python from now on, I think that learning will be better if you know the difference between the two in advance.

Check the importance of features About dataset ・Provided by: California Institute of Technology ・Contents: Heart disease test data ・URL: https://archive.

item.title: I tried to predict Titanic survival on PyCaret
item.description: #Introduction The other day, I tried using the machine learning library PyCaret that was released. Data feature analysis and performance comparison work with multiple models will be automated, and the work time of data scientists up to now will be considerably reduced. This time, I will apply PyCaret to the Titanic survival prediction problem, submit the prediction result to Kaggle, and see the result. **This is a follow-up article to I tried to classify wine quality with PyCaret, which I posted last time.

item.description: #Introduction I am currently a M2 student majoring in CS. I usually write machine learning code in PyTorch. It’s easy to write for the time being. PyTorch is said to be “Define by Run”**, and what is good at the same time when the calculation graph and data are sent is that it is easy to debug because you can check the calculation results on the way. As a PyTorch believer, I need to write code in TensorFlow this time, so I will keep a memo so that I don’t forget the know-how at that time.

item.title: Stock Price Prediction by Machine Learning Numerai
item.description: #Introduction The general public may not have heard about it, but there is a hedge fund called “Numerai”. It is a hedge fund that has been known a little in the neighborhood by being covered by media such as Wired and Forbes from the latter half of 2016 to the first half of 2017. This hedge fund is a so-called crowdsourcing type fund that operates based on the forecast results of stock prices by an unspecified number of people.

item.title: Machine learning algorithms (support vector machines)
item.description: #Introduction Step-by-step about the theory, the implementation in python, and the analysis using scikit-learn of the algorithm taken up in “Classification of machine learning” Learn with. I wrote it for personal learning, so I would like you to take a look at any mistakes. This time about Support Vector Machine. Despite its old history, it is a popular technique in the field of machine learning. It has a high generalization performance, and was the strongest algorithm until it was broken into deep learning by ILSVRC2012.

Parsing Named entity extraction Proper noun (company name) correction Anaphora analysis Keyword extraction Similarity judgment Sentence type judgment User attribute estimation Stagnation removal Voice recognition error detection Sentiment analysis voice recognition Speech synthesis wrap up For details, see here This time, I tried the Japanese test using the similarity judgment.

How to train a large amount of data using TFRecord & DataSet with TensorFlow & Keras-Qiita One thing I want to do is “I want an efficient way to learn huge data that does not fit in memory.” It’s a method that allows CPU data reading and GPU calculation to be processed in parallel. Using the DataSet API, you can efficiently learn from the data saved in a specific format.

item.title: [With Japanese model] Sentence vector model recommended for people who will process natural language in 2020
item.description: ## Summary Create and publish a Japanese model of Sentence-BERT (Papers,Implementation). did. By using this Japanese model, anyone can easily create high-quality sentence vectors. Please use it. Sentence-BERT uses pre-trained BERTmodelandSiameseNetwork , Is a method of creating a highly accurate sentence vector. Cosine similarity using accuracy evaluation of English version (STSbenchmarkandrankcorrelationcoefficientofspearmanofcorrectlabel.1Inthecaseof(closerisbetter),themethodusingtheaverageofsimplewordvectors(GloVe)is0.58,andthemodelcorrespondingtothescalecreatedthistimeisaround0.85(PapersSeeTable2). The accuracy is 0.17 when using the CLS vector of the bare BERT and 0.46 when using the average of the BERT embeddings, which is worse than the result of the average of the word vector (0.

item.title: I tried using PIFu that generates a 3D model of a person from one image
item.description: What is #PIFu Image quote (left): Sumire Uesaka Official Blog Nekomori Meeting PIFu: Pixel-Aligned Implicit Function for High-Resolution Clothed Human Digitization If you explain roughly, A machine learning model that generates a 3D model of a person with clothes from a single image is. We introduce Pixel-aligned Implicit Function (PIFu), a highly effective implicit representation that locally aligns pixels of 2D images with the global context of their corresponding 3D object.

item.title: Understanding Logistic Regression (1)_Odds and Logit Transformation
item.description: #Introduction I have summarized what I learned about odds and logit transformation, which are prerequisites for understanding logistic regression. ##reference In understanding the odds and logit conversion, I have referred to the following. Logistic regression analysis (5) ─ Inverse of logistic transformation Understanding Statistical Analysis-Overview of Logistic Regression Analysis- (StatQuest: Logistic Regression ](https://youtu.be/yIYKR4sgzI8) (StatQuest: Odds and Log(Odds), Clearly Explained!!! ](https://youtu.be/ARfXDSkQf1Y) #Logistic regression Logistic regression overview Logistic regression is an algorithm often used to estimate the probability that a given data will belong to a particular class.

item.title: [Python] Article that enables high-speed sparse matrix calculation
item.description: #Introduction **A sparse matrix is a matrix in which most of the elements of the matrix are 0. It is used in a wide range of fields such as numerical calculation, machine learning, and graph theory (I think). Since most of the matrix is 0, if you devise to ignore 0, you can perform matrix calculation at high speed. For example, if you use a large-scale sparse matrix (nearly 90% is 0) (1 million rows x 1 million columns) and only use non-zero parts, the calculation time will be about 1/10 and the calculation can be completed quickly.

item.title: Challenges for large-scale models such as BERT
item.description: # Breakthrough model of natural language processing-BERT BERT[BidirectionalEncoderRepresentationsfromTransformers]wasannouncedtoGoogle’steaminthefallof2018.Thisistheresultoflearningamodelinarevolutionarywayforaverylargenetworkwithalargeamountofdatausingatransformerarchitecture.PleaserefertoThisarticle for learning method and accuracy. In the field of machine learning where open source and free exchange of information are important, new ideas are published as papers at arxiv.org, and models are shared on github. Doing is the basic way. As soon as new ideas are published, they can be referenced and reused by machine learning researchers and development teams around the world.

If you are an introduction to programming, you can learn from the basics progate progate This is the most recommended learning site for beginners who want to learn programming from now on. The programming terms are very polite and easy to understand, so You will be able to proceed with your learning without any setbacks.

item.title: Predict Titanic survival using Kedro, a machine learning workflow management tool
item.description: #Introduction In this article, I will build a Titanic survival prediction workflow using a library called Kedro. Recently, there are many types of machine learning workflow management tools and construction support tools. Just what I’ve heard, Apache Airflow luigi -gokart Dagster Metaflow DataBolt(d6t) Kedro And so on. Let’s compare the performance of these tools through a common prediction project! That is the origin of this article. As a common project, we chose Titanic survival prediction, which is a path that anyone should go through once they start data analysis.

item.title: I want to understand (engineering) UMAP, which is stronger than t-SNE
item.description: Do you know UMAP? I know If you’ve heard it but don’t know it, this article will help you understand it. #What is UMAP It is a method to reduce and visualize dimensions faster and with higher performance than t-SNE. Compare with the commonly used t-SNE. The following figure is a visualization of Fashion MNIST. (From Understanding UMAP) Compared to t-SNE, UMAP seems to have distinct clusters. Similar categories are placed near each other and dissimilar categories are placed far away.

item.title: Stock investment by deep reinforcement learning (policy gradient method) (1)
item.description: I am a 4th year university student studying reinforcement learning. I have already graduated. I started researching simply thinking that I could make money with the power of AI. Probably because it is financial related, I can not find any information even if I search … So, my research this year “Acquisition of investment strategy by deep reinforcement learning” I’d like to write about it and be helpful for someone somewhere.

From Python to Machine Learning “Multiple Regression Analysis” Understanding Multiple Regression Analysis (Theory) Machine learning Basic In the single regression analysis, $A$ and $B$ were obtained to draw an approximate straight line $$y = Ax + B $$ for $N$ $(x, y)$ on the plane.

item.title: Story that made Mel icon generator
item.description: #Introduction Do you know this icon? Yes, it is the icon of the famous Melville. It is known that there are many people who have Melville draw their favorite characters, etc. and use it as a thumbnail for twitter, and it has gained great support. The icon drawn by this person is often called “Mel icon” due to its unique style. Examples of typical Mel icons (Those of Yukatayu and Shun, respectively.

The execution environment is macOS Mojave + Anaconda 2019.10, and the Python version is 3.7.4. For details, please refer to Chapter 1 of this memo. (To other chapters of this memo: Chapter 1/Chapter2/Chapter3/Chapter4/Chapter5/Chapter6/Chapter7/Chapter8)/Summary)) #7 Convolutional Neural Network This chapter describes Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN).

item.title: I shot Kamehameha using OpenPose
item.description: #Introduction I wanted to shoot Kamehameha so I made it. You can also hide the estimation line. The coordinates of the joint are acquired using OpenPose, the angle is calculated from that, and it is judged whether the pose looks like that. About OpenPose How to set up I used tf pose estimation which is Tensorflow version of OpenPose. My environment was Windows10, GTX1070, etc., so I referred to the following page for setup.

item.title: [Dimension curse] Can the number of sensors be changed to ∞ to detect anomalies?
item.description: Since the IOT became popular, efforts have been made to increase the number of sensors in order to predictively maintain machinery. Is being done. Rumor has it that there are cases where 100 sensors are attached to one machine. The question is, is it justified to increase the number of sensors? In other words, does **adding extra sensors not affect the anomaly detection performance? When That is it. In this paper, we focus on the curse of dimension, “When we increase the number of extra sensors, we detect anomalies.

item.title: Why Deep Metric Learning based on the Softmax function works
item.description: #Introduction In distance learning (metric learning) using deep learning, similarities (and dissimilarities) between images are used by using Contrastive Loss and Triplet Loss.) Is widely used, but it is also known that it is difficult to combine and select learning data, and learning itself is difficult in many cases. For that reason, various improvements and ideas have been proposed so far. However, recently, metric learning, which can learn based on the Softmax function as if it is a general class classification task without the difficulty of selecting learning data like this, has been attracting attention.

item.title: [Machine learning] Understand logistic regression from both scikit-learn and mathematics
item.description: #1. Purpose If you want to do machine learning, anyone can use scikit-learn etc. to implement it relatively easily. However, in order to achieve results at work or to improve your level, The explanation “I don’t really understand the background, but I got this result” is clearly weak. In this article, the two aims are to “use the scikit-learn first because the theory is good” and to “understand the background from mathematics” from the fourth and later.

item.title: There are many books on machine learning, but which should I buy? Recommended by level! ! <For beginners>
item.description: #Introduction There are many books on machine learning, but I recommend you to buy one by level. There are 5 levels from Level 1 to Level 5. Please choose a book from the level that suits you. It will be best if you read the books introduced here in 3 to 4 months. I don’t cover studying methods in this note, but there are some very good online courses, such as Cousera’s machine learning courses, so please try using services other than books.

item.title: Deep Learning Association G test study method (for beginners) [2020 edition]

What is the Deep Learning Association G Test? *This document’s calligraphy is used with the permission of the publisher (or the image in the common database of the publishing industry from the publisher Dotcom).

item.title: 40-year-old engineer manager passed Deep Learning for ENGINEER
item.description: ## What is Deep Learning for ENGINEER Please note that this article is current as of January 2020. Currently, the following official qualifications are available to prove AI skills in Japan. JDLA Deep Learning for GENERAL (G test) JDLA Deep Learning for ENGINEER (E qualification) is. Positioned as a test, the G test asks general education about AI-related technology. E-qualification is an exam that understands the theory of AI-related technology and asks the skills to implement AI.

item.title: Proposal of voice conversion and voice quality morphing among multiple speakers by RelGAN-VM
item.description: #Imakita Sangyo There is an image conversion model called RelGAN! It’s applied to voice quality conversion! You can morph your voice! #Introduction The number of men who want to become beautiful girls is increasing. On the contrary, there are many women who want to become beautiful boys. In recent years, this trend has become particularly noticeable with the popularity of virtual YouTuber. Regarding appearance, it is becoming an era when MMD of CG technology and Live2D that can move illustrations have appeared and it can gradually transform into what you want to be, but you want to be the voice of a cute girl or the voice of a cool boy.

Wearing the characteristic eyebrows, beard, and afro hair, you are now “Mr. Satan”! Miscellaneous (w)! Technically, the face_recognition library is used to acquire the coordinates of various parts of the face, and the positions and sizes of the eyebrows, whiskers, and afro are calculated and drawn based on them. What is #face_recognition

item.title: Predict the existence of affair with machine learning
item.description: Introduction I used Udemy [50,000 people in the world] practice Python data science to analyze data using python. .. The data used this time is sample data contained in a library called Statsmodels, which will be the paper of a survey conducted in 1974 regarding the presence or absence of affair with married women. Affairs dataset The purpose of this time is Using the sample data, we will create a model that predicts the existence of affair by machine learning and predict which attribute influences the result.

item.title: Learning Graph Convolutional Networks with PyTorch
item.description: ** [Twitter](https://twitter.com/omiita_atiimo)introducesartificialintelligenceandarticleswritteninothermedia**,soifyouwanttoknowmoreaboutartificialintelligence,**Pleasefeelfreetofollowus(https://twitter.com/omiita_atiimo)! ** Learning with PyTorch Graph Convolutional Networks In this article, I will explain GCN, which has been attracting a lot of attention as a neural network that can vectorize (embed) graph structures in recent years, and PyTorch Geometric, a library that can easily use GCN. The fields of application range from biology to traffic jam prediction and recommender systems. This article is GCN creator’s blog articleand[PyTorchGeometricofficialtutorial](https://pytorch-geometric.readthedocs.io/en(/latest/index.html) is used as a reference.

item.title: Can AI distinguish Carlos Ghosn and Mr. Bean (Face recognition using face landmark)
item.description: #Introduction The news is about the news that Carlos Ghosn, the former chairman of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd., broke bail conditions and traveled to Lebanon. I’ve been thinking for a long time, but it’s similar to Mr. Bean… Left: [Carlos Ghosn](https://www.google.com/search?q=Carlos+Ghosn&sxsrf=ACYBGNS1gsNQxqfqi7GRWUUeSSZ6CRix8w:1577813710879&source=lnms&tbm=isch&Ah&EqjQAQBQ&QAQBQBQ&QAQBQ&QB Right: [Mr. Bean (Rowan Atkinson)](https://www.google.com/search?q=rowan+atkinson&biw=1386&bih=710&sxsrf=ACYBGNTsdddnLF7jgPr9RTePeEMGgREpyA:1577813660092&source=lnms&tbm=isch&saQ&isch&saq It was a year-end and New Year holiday, so I made a little classifier using a neural network. If you google it, a lot of images of the two people will appear, so it was good for CNN, but This time, as another approach, I would like to perform classification based on the position of landmarks on the face.

item.title: Why is cross entropy used for the objective function of classification problems?
item.description: # What is a classification problem The classification problem is to classify data into several categories and is one of the typical methods of machine learning. Let’s take a purchasing site as an example. Predict whether a user will buy or not buy a new product based on the user’s purchasing information. Classification into two categories (classes) is called binary classification. Classification predictions with more than two classes are called multiclass classifications.

item.description: # Half-year when the Gori Gori literary system (deviation value 40 first half) learned AI Hi, it’s a rugged ~~ macho~~ humanities. After graduating from commercial high school, I went to the Faculty of Humanities, so it’s different from other humanities. It is a thoroughbred world of humanities. Although it is a vital math skill, I only studied math A up to high school, and just started math at university.

item.title: Machine learning with Pokemon
item.description: ## Introduction The Pokemon Sword Shield was launched last month. By the way, have you ever played Pokemon? As anyone who has played Pokemon will know, Pokemon has the ability value which consists of HP, Kogeki, Bogyo, Tokukou, Tokubo, and Quickness. It can be said that the higher the ability value is, the stronger the Pokemon is. Ability score is calculated from three values: race value, individual value and effort value.

item.title: Full disclosure of methods used in machine learning
item.description: ## Introduction There are increasing opportunities for anyone to learn machine learning, such as kaggle and learning sites. On the other hand, I feel that there are many people who have too much information and don’t get the overall feeling. Therefore, I will publish the methods used in machine learning introduced in various reference books and articles. Please refer to that link for detailed coding. Since various information is also sent on SNS, please feel free to read the article.

item.title: How to use machine learning for work? 02_AI development project overview
item.description: ## Introduction I am writing a series on the theme “To use machine learning for work”. In this second article, I will organize how AI development projects proceed. The chapters are as follows. What is the difference between AI development and machine learning? Overview of AI development Where to use machine learning in AI development? Steps to build the model What is machine learning? If you feel that your understanding of is suspicious, you should read “Part 1: Understanding the Purpose of Machine Learning”.

item.title: Probabilistic model mmvec to detect correlation between microbiome and metabolome
item.description: Article on the last day of the Metagenomic Advent Calendar. I'm sorry for just registering and posting... Introduction of how to use microbe–metabolite vectors, abbreviated mmvec, a method to detect the correlation between microbiome and metabolome. (Morton, et al. “Learning representations of microbe–metabolite interactions.” Nature Methods 16, 1306–1314 (2019)) As you can see from the fact that word2vec and word sense are aligned (?), it is a method of learning latent vectors expressing the relationship between paired microbiome and metabolome data sets.

item.title: I tried to summarize the basic form of GPLVM
item.description: This article is from [Furukawa Lab, Advent_calendar Day 23](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/flab). #Introduction GPLVM is an unsupervised learning method that uses Gaussian process (GP) and can estimate low-dimensional manifolds whose data are distributed in high-dimensional space. The main attraction of GPLVM is that the model is very simple and highly expandable, and theoretically easy to handle. In fact, it has been extended to more complex situations such as Bayesian estimation of hyperparameters, time series data analysis 1, multiview analysis 2, and tensor decomposition 3.

item.title: For those who look at the log while learning with machine learning ~ Muscle training with LightGBM ~
item.description: What do you guys do when learning models with machine learning? Did you just look at the log output to the console? “Oh, it was lower than I expected!” “Oh, the accuracy is getting worse, do your best!!” It’s surprisingly fun to think, though. But when I cheered up, the model doesn’t do its best, and there is no dramatic development, so it’s a waste of time to look at it.

item.title: How to use machine learning for work? 01_Understand the purpose of machine learning
item.description: Hello everyone. I started Qiita from today. As a machine learning engineer, I am usually involved in AI development and web application development. In private, I became a newbie daddy. I am writing an article while holding my eldest son who will be 4 months (laugh) As a motivation to write an article, I have been working on machine learning since 2017 when there was no reference book yet, I always feel that the experience of having a hard time learning machine learning is useful for someone.

item.title: Try using PHATE, a dimension reduction and visualization method for biological data
item.description: # Try using PHATE, a dimension reduction and visualization method for biological data PHATE (Moon, KR, van Dijk, D., Wang, Z. et al. Nature Biotechnology 37, 1482–1492 (2019)) Try to use. There are a lot of methods of dimension reduction used in biology papers, but each method has advantages and disadvantages. The following methods are often used as typical ones. PCA: principal component analysis. Take out the axis of maximum dispersion.

item.title: [Note spoilers] PyTorch is going to predict a five-part bride
item.description:
I'm going to rely on the five equally divided bride (serious face) Learn the techniques of pytorch and Deep Learning while applying a five-part bride The pytorch code I used this time is basically here https://github.com/yoyoyo-yo/DeepLearningMugenKnock This is spoiler for some viewers, so if you don’t like it, please close the window immediately
> Recently, the author has declared that the comic will be finished in 14 volumes, and it seemed like a great progress in terms of story.

item.title: CNN (U-net, DnCNN, WIN5-RB) that restores images full of noise and graffiti, and images blurred with zoom
item.description: #Introduction Deep learning is a method recently used to clean dirty images, remove graffiti from images, and restore poorly-zoomed images. The principle is simple, just input a noisy image to the converter and output a beautiful image. Such converters are often made up of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN). In this article, I will try to implement such CNN with pytorch and see the results. There are various CNN models like this, but this time I will try with three CNN models and compare the results.

item.title: The guy who predicts the number of views from the title of Jarjar's video
item.description: #Introduction This time, I will talk about making a model that predicts the number of views from the title of Jarjar’s video. Since NLP is a complete amateur, I tried to imitate the appearance by referring to the articles of other people. What is jar jar JALJAL is a comedy group with the most momentum*, consisting of Junpei Goto and Shusuke Fukutoku, who belong to the Yoshimoto Kogyo Tokyo headquarters.

MediaPipe With the announcement of MediaPipe at CVPR 2019 in June this year, Hand Tracking has been released as one of the applications. MediaPipe doesn’t require you to write code called ML pipeline A framework for building ML applications using only visualization tools.

item.title: Clipping and normalization in TensorFlow
item.description: # Overview This is an article about clipping each value held by tensor handled by TensorFlow. Specifically, it is an explanation and implementation example of the tf.clip_by... method. Why do you do this in the first place? I think there are various uses, but in machine learning related calculations (especially gradient calculation), which is the main purpose of TensorFlow, there are many cases where the sense of scale of the handled variables is different and it can not be calculated well.

item.title: Uncle SE whose brain was hardened studied machine learning

The motivation was to start with the question, “Can you use machine learning?” Since I was working in the dark clouds, my honest memory is vague. career I have been programming for nearly 30 years. Starting with MS BASIC I learned when I was in elementary school, I have touched Z80 assembler, MC68000 assembler, FORTRAN, C (UNIX), C++ (Mac), VB, Java (Android), VB.

I’m in charge of Natural Language Processing Advent Calendar 2019 (I’m sorry for delaying one day!!!) https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/nlp I want to automatically make a control like Sandwich Man, and I want to sell it to a comedy office for 4000 trillion yen. And I want to see Sandwich Man!

item.title: I made a muscle training estimation application using Qore SDK
item.description: ## tl;dr I made a muscle training estimation app Qore uses an algorithm called reservoir computing Performed a task of classifying time series data from acceleration data that can be acquired with a smartphone -Code Pretty good -99.6% accuracy with test data This should make you a muscle engineer Strategy Collect accelerometer data with a smartphone (iphone) Time series data with three components on the x, y and z axes is available Learn with 4 types of muscle training: push-ups, abs, squats, abs You can tell what kind of muscle training you did with only your smartphone Data collection Do your muscle workout with your smartphone in your pants pocket -This time, in any muscle training, put the smartphone in the pocket in the same direction -It seems that it will be more difficult to estimate if it is set in a different direction

item.title: I studied at Kaggle's Titanic (kaggle②)

This time I would like to proceed to the point where I will study at the “Titanic competition”. Is it possible to exceed the correct rate “76%” in the sample code?

item.title: Recommended learning order for beginners of machine learning and deep learning
item.description: # Target of this article Purpose of writing the article The words AI and deep learning have been around for a long time, but I don’t think there are many people who really understand their meaning. I think it’s very dangerous to have a debate about what AI can do, as in Japan today. I think the reason why there is such a debate about AI in this way is that you do not fully understand the mathematical basis of machine learning.

item.title: [Explanation with image] Use pickle with Kaggle NoteBook
item.description: # things to do Pickle data set of csv file Load the pickle file into another notebook What is # pickle? A python object that saves binary data https://docs.python.org/ja/3/library/pickle.html What are you happy about? Read quickly It’s binary data, so parsing is fast. You can also use learned models as pickles This verification article is wonderful Python: I checked the persistence format of pandas Try with Titanic data Let’s make train.

item.title: I tried Metaflow, an ML workflow tool developed by Netflix [Overview]
item.description: Netflix has released [Metaflow](https://metaflow.org), a Python library for managing machine learning workflows. With this, Data processing/model building process can be described in a uniform format, making it easy to follow the overall flow Version control of model and pretreatment process is possible Distributed processing is possible on AWS environment There are advantages such as. If you are curious, let’s go through the official documentationwhilerunningthetutorial. .. For Tutorial, after inserting the library with pip install metaflow,

item.title: KawaiiGen: Behind the Python module for generating cute girl face images
item.description: ## What is kawaii-gen We recently released python module kawaii-gen that generates cute idol face images. In this article, I will explain the model of stylegan used in this module and the data pipeline implemented to create a data set for stylegan. stylegan is a GAN that has a resolution of 1024x1024 pixels and can generate photographic images, and the space of hidden variables has high linear separability and complementarity.

item.title: Do Houdini with Python3! ! !
item.description: #Introduction The second adcare article this year. The first one was “[Verify new installation method of SideFX Labs Tool, Package function]” (https://qiita.com/takavfx/items/d1698b89df6fb1b86f9c). So this time, let’s take a different angle. At this time, by using a model using deep learning, modeling in machine learning and deep learning is often done in the third AI boom, and it is common sense nowadays to use machine learning/deep learning for AI.

item.title: Memory-saving conversion of log data into sequential category features considering time series
item.description: #Introduction Hi, I’m a machine learning engineer. I’m Kawamoto. I had a cold because it was too cold. Today, I will write about how to perform preprocessing while suppressing memory consumption for log data that needs to consider time series information. Thing you want to do Assuming there is a data set containing behavior logs for each user like this, userid itemid categoryid timestamp 0 0 3 1 2019-01-04 1 0 4 1 2019-01-08 2 0 4 1 2019-01-19 3 0 5 1 2019-01-02 4 0 7 2 2019-01-17 5 0 8 2 2019-01-07 6 1 0 0 2019-01-06 7 1 1 0 2019-01-14 8 1 2 0 2019-01-20 9 1 6 2 2019-01-01 10 1 7 2 2019-01-12 11 1 8 2 2019-01-18 12 2 3 1 2019-01-16 13 2 4 1 2019-01-15 14 2 5 1 2019-01-10 15 2 5 1 2019-01-13 16 2 6 2 2019-01-03 17 2 7 2 2019-01-05 18 2 8 2 2019-01-11 19 2 8 2 2019-01-21 20 2 9 3 2019-01-09 Variable length series data sorted by time for each user as follows,

item.title: Use Kaggle API inside Docker container
item.description: # things to do Start container using Kaggle official image (kaggle/python) Download csv file with kaggle ~ command Download public notebook with kaggle ~ command First summary DL kaggle.json (kaggle.com >My Account >Create New API Token button) 2.$ docker run -it --rm --mount type=bind,src=pwd,dst=/root/dev kaggle/python $ pip install kaggle $ mkdir ~/.kaggle $ cp /root/dev/kaggle.json ~/.kaggle 6.$ chmod 600 ~/.kaggle/kaggle.json $ kaggle competitions download -c titanic -p input/titanic $ unzip input/titanic/titanic.

item.title: Create a machine learning app with ABEJA Platform + LINE Bot
item.description: This article is from the second day of [ABEJA Advent Calendar 2019](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/abeja). Last year’s ABEJA Platform Advent Calendarsaid,“SummaryofABEJAPlatformauthentication”, I introduced the authentication of API calls on the ABEJA Platform, but I wrote it again this year on the ABEJA Platform newsletter. Unfortunately, the ABEJA Platform does not support Elixir, so all the code is written in Python. Overview Posted in July 2019 by @yushin_n"CreatemachinelearningapplicationwithABEJAPlatform+CloudFunctions+LINEBot'’, ABEJA Platform Google Cloud Functions LINE Bot The theme was to create a serverless machine learning application by combining.

item.title: I don't want to search for high para because it is IQ1 (how to use lightgbm_tuner)
item.description: This article is posted on [IQ1's 2nd Advent Calendar 2019](https://adventar.org/calendars/4711). IQ1 machine learning For machine learning, data preprocessing and model hyper search are inevitable. However, I have an IQ of 1, so I don’t want to do it if I can do preprocessing of data and high-para search. If you put the preprocessing of data into this modern gradient boosting tree system algorithm (such as lightgbm), you can handle the missing values as they are and you do not have to preprocess the categorical variables, so it will be a world relatively friendly to IQ1.

item.title: Machine learning Machine learning learned by a new graduate who has no experience in machine learning
item.description: This article is about how I learned machine learning by Nikkei xTECH Business AI② Advent Calendar 2019 __. Let’s talk about the steps that have taken a slightly different step from the general approach to learning machine learning. I would be happy if it could be used as a reference for as many people as possible. I usually write for individual blogs, and I was warmly thinking about writing on my blog, but I thought it was a great opportunity, so I posted it on __qiita for the first time __.

item.title: Built environment for machine learning from 0 (windows10 + Anaconda + VSCode + Tensorflow + GPU version)

Overview Machine learning (reinforcement learning) environment built from almost 0 (GPU compatible) Environment windows10 NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 Build environment Anaconda VSCode Tensorflow GPU compatible settings Cooperation between Anaconda and VS Code ChainerRL Preparation for using Tensorflow GPU version *Not required when using the CPU version.

Introduction In this article, I will introduce the UKR (Unsupervised Kernel Regression) that I actually made. I translated it into an unsupervised kernel regression, I read and implemented this paper. If you are interested in manifold learning, please join us.

item.title: Kaggle Tutorial Know-how in the top 2% of Titanic
item.description: #1.First of all Since I started studying machine learning, I tried Kaggle’s tutorial for beginners, Titanic. At first, I tried to play around with the feature amount on my own, referring to Japanese Web information, but even if the training data showed good accuracy, when I submitted the test data, the accuracy did not rise as expected, It was difficult to break the wall of 80% and I was in agony.

item.title: ``First time learning'' that even university students with no knowledge can do-AWS SageMaker
item.description: # My background Amazon? Ah, you know, you know, a mail order app. Not long ago, knowledge about Amazon was that much. Of course, I didn’t even know AWS. I’m ashamed as an information undergraduate student. However, as a 3rd year university student, I was introduced to the lab and learned about AWS. In addition, I am addicted to the topic “Atsuhiko Nakata’s YouTube University”, which is a hot topic in this street.

item.title: Speech recognition by Python MFCC
item.description: In the [previous article](https://qiita.com/k-maru/items/4f12fd0f8344b9e093bd),vowelrecognitionwasperformedusingformantanalysis.IlearnedaboutMFCCinaninternshipat[CyceedCo.,Ltd.](http://www.sciseed.jp/), and verified the classification accuracy, so this article is a continuation of the previous article about MFCC that is often used for speech recognition. I would like to summarize. ##table of contents Background What is MFCC -MFCC derivation process Implementation of MFCC derivation program -Regarding librosa -Derivation of MFCC -Phoneme class classification using MFCC Implementation of a program for continuous speech recognition -Regarding dynamic differences -Derivation of primary and secondary differences -Phoneme class classification including features of second-order differences Consideration Summary Reference background Previous article formant analysis finds the envelope of the spectrum, and the frequencies emphasized in them are used as features from lower to F1 and F2.

item.title: [Beginner] Learn Python basic grammar in 5 hours for free!

If you have finished learning Python, please use AI Academy,whereyoucanlearnAIandmachinelearningforfree(onlysomecontentsarechargedbutbasiccontentsarealmostfree). .. *For short-term AI boot camps for individuals, click here (https://aiacademy.jp/bootcamp/) Why Python? **AI Academyhandleslearningcontentscenteredontheartificialintelligence(AI) field, and Python handles machine learning and deep learning easily in the artificial intelligence field.

item.title: Smoother pipeline processing in Luigi! Introducing gokart
item.description: # what is this? This is a summary article about gokart, a wrapper library for Luigi. The motivation for development and basic usage are summarized in M3’s blog very carefully, and the basic usage is It’s a story that I should read this, but I wanted to summarize it as a reverse lookup reference, so I made an article. The functions of Luigi itself are not explained so much.

item.title: Score-CAM implementation with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM
item.description: # Overview Implemented the method “Score-CAM” of Paper posted on arxiv on October 3, 2019 with keras. Comparison with Grad-CAM, Grad-CAM++. Implemented the independently accelerated Faster Score-CAM. Applied to the model trained on DAGM dataset. The code can be found on github. What is # Score-CAM? One of the visualization methods of the basis of judgment of CNN -There is a wonderful summary on here for understanding the judgment basis.

item.title: Gaussian process and machine learning Gaussian process regression implemented only by numpy of Python
item.description: I recently read ["Gaussian Process and Machine Learning"](https://www.amazon.co.jp/GaussianProcessandMachineLearning-MachineLearningProfessionalSeries-Mochihashi-Daichi/dp/4061529269) I implemented it. The content is “3.4.2 Gaussian Process Regression Calculation” in Chapter 3. Deer is a landmark. It is easy to understand and highly recommended. What is the Gauss process? First of all, to explain the Gaussian process in one word, At Y=f(X) “If input X is similar, output Y is similar." It is a tool for mathematically expressing that property.

item.title: What an amateur stumbled upon in Deep Learning made from scratch Memo: Chapter 1
item.description: #Introduction Suddenly, I thought “[Deep Learning from scratch-the theory and implementation of deep learning learned with Python]” (https://www.oreilly.co.jp/books/9784873117584/) and “Deep Learning from scratch ( 2)-Natural language processing” I decided to study. However, I am very worried whether I will not be able to take the time to continue. However, when I completed [Language Processing 100 Knock 2015]2-3yearsago,Amateurlanguageprocessing100knocks I continued to post to Qiita, and thanks to everyone’s likes and comments, I was able to finish it, so again this time Qiita’s I decided to help.
